alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 2:44AM MST until August 21 at 5:45AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 545 AM MST. * At 242 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour in an area that received heavy rain earlier Saturday evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Yavapai County including Wickenburg Ranch This includes the following highways... Highway 93 between mile markers 190 and 196. State Route 89 between mile markers 258 and 266. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Hassayampa River, Whipsaw Creek, Martinez Creek, Buckhorn Creek, Hamlin Wash, Weaver Creek, Antelope Creek, Martinez Wash, Slim Jim Creek, Sols Wash and Amazon Gulch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
